description:
Ready for take off!  Discover how spinning motors and pulley wheels can launch a paper plane at up to 40 km/h. 

 Build your paper plane launcher, try out some different paper plane designs and then launch them! Work out which designs fly furthest, fastest or do the best acrobatics!

 The plane launcher uses two rotating wheels . A lot of energy is stored in the wheels when they are spinning. When you slip your paper plane in between, some of the energy is transferred to it and the plane is launched out at high speed.

 You can adjust the height of the legs on the plane launcher to launch the planes at different angles.

 An educational kit that demonstrates a scientific principle in a fun way. Assembly and operation of the toy should be supervised by an adult - they won’t be able to help themselves - who doesn’t love playing with paper planes, no matter what the age!

 Produced by award-winning toy manufacturer 4M, leaders in STEAM toys for kids.

 Educational but super fun nature of the toy makes it a winner with kids (and parents) - they don’t even realise they are learning science and engineering skills while they are building and playing with this toy.

 Age 8+

title: Sight Word Swat Game: Fun Educational Board Game for Kids Aged 4+ Building Reading Confidence with 300 High-Frequency Words!
Sight Word Swat Game
description: Sight Word Swat Game An Engaging Educational Game for Young Readers to Master Sight Words with Fun and Speed Get ready for a reading adventure with the Sight Word Swat Game, a super fun and energetic way for children to become word-whiz kids! This game is designed to make learning essential sight words an absolute blast, building confidence with every swat. Sight words are those super important words that fluent readers recognize instantly, like magic! Some are easy to sound out, but others, the tricky ones, need a little memorization, and that's exactly where this game shines. Players grab their very own child-sized fly swatters, colorful and perfectly sized for little hands. As words are called out, it's a race to see who can spot and swat the fly card showing the correct sight word first! The player with the most swatted flies at the end of the round is declared the sight word champion! This game is fantastic for budding readers aged 4 and up, and it’s perfect for family game nights, supporting 1 to 4 players. It’s thoughtfully color-coded to align with the Letters & Sounds phonics program, making it a breeze to weave into learning, whether you're a parent or a teacher using various phonics approaches in UK primary schools. Inside this exciting box, you'll discover 300 high-frequency words, conveniently categorized from phases 2–6 of the Letters & Sounds framework, and the color-coding on the cards makes sorting and choosing them for play super simple. For those just starting their reading journey, you can begin with a smaller selection of cards from a particular phase, and as they grow more confident, you can introduce more cards or even mix in cards from different phases to add an extra layer of fun and challenge. We've even highlighted those "tricky" words with a special marker to gently remind little learners that these are the ones that can't be sounded out phonetically, encouraging them to memorize them. The game set includes 4 vibrant and durable fly swatters, each measuring a perfect 23cm, along with 150 double-sided fly cards packed with words, and easy-to-follow instructions to get the fun started right away. The plastic swatters are built to last through countless rounds of energetic play. This game is not just about memorization; it's about developing quick recognition skills and fostering a positive association with reading. The fast-paced nature of the game keeps little ones engaged and excited, transforming potentially challenging words into a thrilling challenge. It’s an ideal way to supplement classroom learning or to enjoy an enriching playtime at home. Prepare for giggles, excitement, and a significant leap in reading fluency as your child becomes a master of sight words with the Sight Word Swat Game!

Sight words are a selection of words that readers can instantly and effortlessly recognise. Some of these words can be phonetically decoded while others – known as tricky words – can’t and need to be memorised. Sight Word Swat is a fun, fast-paced game that helps young readers build confidence in this essential aspect of reading and literacy learning. Players use child-sized fly swatters to swat the fly cards with the correct sight word answers to the questions that are called out. The player with the most flies at the end of the round wins! Suitable for 1–4 players.

 Sight Word Swat is colour-coded to the Letters & Sounds programme and is easy to integrate into lesson planning across a range of phonics programmes used in UK primary schools.

  
 * This game features 300 high frequency words from phases 2–6 of the Letters & Sounds phonics framework and cards are colour-coded to make it easy to sort and use. 
 * For beginner readers, use fewer cards than the total available in the applicable phase. For more advanced readers, play with additional cards or use cards from another phase to challenge or reinforce words. 
 * "Tricky" words are highlighted for easy identification to remind children that they can't sound out these words phonetically. 
 * Includes 4 colourful fly swatters, 150 double-sided flies and instructions. Plastic swatters measure 23cm L. 
 * Suitable for 1 – 4 players.  Age 4+.

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work. This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations! Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits. title: Sight Word Swat Game: Fun Educational Board Game for Kids Aged 4+ Building Reading Confidence with 300 High-Frequency Words!
Sight Word Swat Game
description: Sight Word Swat Game An Engaging Educational Game for Young Readers to Master Sight Words with Fun and Speed Get ready for a reading adventure with the Sight Word Swat Game, a super fun and energetic way for children to become word-whiz kids! This game is designed to make learning essential sight words an absolute blast, building confidence with every swat. Sight words are those super important words that fluent readers recognize instantly, like magic! Some are easy to sound out, but others, the tricky ones, need a little memorization, and that's exactly where this game shines. Players grab their very own child-sized fly swatters, colorful and perfectly sized for little hands. As words are called out, it's a race to see who can spot and swat the fly card showing the correct sight word first! The player with the most swatted flies at the end of the round is declared the sight word champion! This game is fantastic for budding readers aged 4 and up, and it’s perfect for family game nights, supporting 1 to 4 players. It’s thoughtfully color-coded to align with the Letters & Sounds phonics program, making it a breeze to weave into learning, whether you're a parent or a teacher using various phonics approaches in UK primary schools. Inside this exciting box, you'll discover 300 high-frequency words, conveniently categorized from phases 2–6 of the Letters & Sounds framework, and the color-coding on the cards makes sorting and choosing them for play super simple. For those just starting their reading journey, you can begin with a smaller selection of cards from a particular phase, and as they grow more confident, you can introduce more cards or even mix in cards from different phases to add an extra layer of fun and challenge. We've even highlighted those "tricky" words with a special marker to gently remind little learners that these are the ones that can't be sounded out phonetically, encouraging them to memorize them. The game set includes 4 vibrant and durable fly swatters, each measuring a perfect 23cm, along with 150 double-sided fly cards packed with words, and easy-to-follow instructions to get the fun started right away. The plastic swatters are built to last through countless rounds of energetic play. This game is not just about memorization; it's about developing quick recognition skills and fostering a positive association with reading. The fast-paced nature of the game keeps little ones engaged and excited, transforming potentially challenging words into a thrilling challenge. It’s an ideal way to supplement classroom learning or to enjoy an enriching playtime at home. Prepare for giggles, excitement, and a significant leap in reading fluency as your child becomes a master of sight words with the Sight Word Swat Game!

Sight words are a selection of words that readers can instantly and effortlessly recognise. Some of these words can be phonetically decoded while others – known as tricky words – can’t and need to be memorised. Sight Word Swat is a fun, fast-paced game that helps young readers build confidence in this essential aspect of reading and literacy learning. Players use child-sized fly swatters to swat the fly cards with the correct sight word answers to the questions that are called out. The player with the most flies at the end of the round wins! Suitable for 1–4 players.

 Sight Word Swat is colour-coded to the Letters & Sounds programme and is easy to integrate into lesson planning across a range of phonics programmes used in UK primary schools.

  
 * This game features 300 high frequency words from phases 2–6 of the Letters & Sounds phonics framework and cards are colour-coded to make it easy to sort and use. 
 * For beginner readers, use fewer cards than the total available in the applicable phase. For more advanced readers, play with additional cards or use cards from another phase to challenge or reinforce words. 
 * "Tricky" words are highlighted for easy identification to remind children that they can't sound out these words phonetically. 
 * Includes 4 colourful fly swatters, 150 double-sided flies and instructions. Plastic swatters measure 23cm L. 
 * Suitable for 1 – 4 players.  Age 4+.

Ready for take off!  Discover how spinning motors and pulley wheels can launch a paper plane at up to 40 km/h. 

 Build your paper plane launcher, try out some different paper plane designs and then launch them! Work out which designs fly furthest, fastest or do the best acrobatics!

 The plane launcher uses two rotating wheels . A lot of energy is stored in the wheels when they are spinning. When you slip your paper plane in between, some of the energy is transferred to it and the plane is launched out at high speed.

 You can adjust the height of the legs on the plane launcher to launch the planes at different angles.

 An educational kit that demonstrates a scientific principle in a fun way. Assembly and operation of the toy should be supervised by an adult - they won’t be able to help themselves - who doesn’t love playing with paper planes, no matter what the age!

 Produced by award-winning toy manufacturer 4M, leaders in STEAM toys for kids.

 Educational but super fun nature of the toy makes it a winner with kids (and parents) - they don’t even realise they are learning science and engineering skills while they are building and playing with this toy.

 Age 8+

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

description:
Going up! Build an adorable robotic gecko that defies gravity to crawl up, down, and all around smooth vertical surfaces!

 As you assemble this motorised, multi-legged machine with suction cup feet and an innovative gear system, you’ll learn about its inner mechanisms including an electric circuit complete with motor, battery, and switch. Then experiment to see which types of surfaces your Geckobot can climb best and read about how suction cups work and how this robot climbs.

 This hands-on construction kit brings engineering and physics to life as it demonstrates the power of air pressure at work. A 16-page, full-colour manual guides your model building with step-by-step illustrated instructions.

Ready for take off!  Discover how spinning motors and pulley wheels can launch a paper plane at up to 40 km/h. 

 Build your paper plane launcher, try out some different paper plane designs and then launch them! Work out which designs fly furthest, fastest or do the best acrobatics!

 The plane launcher uses two rotating wheels . A lot of energy is stored in the wheels when they are spinning. When you slip your paper plane in between, some of the energy is transferred to it and the plane is launched out at high speed.

 You can adjust the height of the legs on the plane launcher to launch the planes at different angles.

 An educational kit that demonstrates a scientific principle in a fun way. Assembly and operation of the toy should be supervised by an adult - they won’t be able to help themselves - who doesn’t love playing with paper planes, no matter what the age!

 Produced by award-winning toy manufacturer 4M, leaders in STEAM toys for kids.

 Educational but super fun nature of the toy makes it a winner with kids (and parents) - they don’t even realise they are learning science and engineering skills while they are building and playing with this toy.

 Age 8+

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age.  Sized just right for little hands, this build-it-yourself toy's chunky plastic pieces are ready to help kids design, build, and tinker with their own robot squad during open-ended play sessions.

 Build tall bots with squiggly green legs, add a few eyes to help your creation see, or snap on a propeller that really spins!

 1-2-3 Build It! Robot Factory also comes with an Activity Guide featuring recommended builds, which helps kids learn essential STEM skills ranging from critical thinking and early engineering to following directions!

 The pieces in the 1-2-3 Build It! Robot Factory set work with all 1-2-3 Build It! building sets, so kids can make their creations even crazier!

 Age 2-6

Ready for take off!  Discover how spinning motors and pulley wheels can launch a paper plane at up to 40 km/h. 

 Build your paper plane launcher, try out some different paper plane designs and then launch them! Work out which designs fly furthest, fastest or do the best acrobatics!

 The plane launcher uses two rotating wheels . A lot of energy is stored in the wheels when they are spinning. When you slip your paper plane in between, some of the energy is transferred to it and the plane is launched out at high speed.

 You can adjust the height of the legs on the plane launcher to launch the planes at different angles.

 An educational kit that demonstrates a scientific principle in a fun way. Assembly and operation of the toy should be supervised by an adult - they won’t be able to help themselves - who doesn’t love playing with paper planes, no matter what the age!

 Produced by award-winning toy manufacturer 4M, leaders in STEAM toys for kids.

 Educational but super fun nature of the toy makes it a winner with kids (and parents) - they don’t even realise they are learning science and engineering skills while they are building and playing with this toy.

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

Ready for take off!  Discover how spinning motors and pulley wheels can launch a paper plane at up to 40 km/h. 

 Build your paper plane launcher, try out some different paper plane designs and then launch them! Work out which designs fly furthest, fastest or do the best acrobatics!

 The plane launcher uses two rotating wheels . A lot of energy is stored in the wheels when they are spinning. When you slip your paper plane in between, some of the energy is transferred to it and the plane is launched out at high speed.

 You can adjust the height of the legs on the plane launcher to launch the planes at different angles.

 An educational kit that demonstrates a scientific principle in a fun way. Assembly and operation of the toy should be supervised by an adult - they won’t be able to help themselves - who doesn’t love playing with paper planes, no matter what the age!

 Produced by award-winning toy manufacturer 4M, leaders in STEAM toys for kids.

 Educational but super fun nature of the toy makes it a winner with kids (and parents) - they don’t even realise they are learning science and engineering skills while they are building and playing with this toy.

 Age 8+

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

Ready for take off!  Discover how spinning motors and pulley wheels can launch a paper plane at up to 40 km/h. 

 Build your paper plane launcher, try out some different paper plane designs and then launch them! Work out which designs fly furthest, fastest or do the best acrobatics!

 The plane launcher uses two rotating wheels . A lot of energy is stored in the wheels when they are spinning. When you slip your paper plane in between, some of the energy is transferred to it and the plane is launched out at high speed.

 You can adjust the height of the legs on the plane launcher to launch the planes at different angles.

 An educational kit that demonstrates a scientific principle in a fun way. Assembly and operation of the toy should be supervised by an adult - they won’t be able to help themselves - who doesn’t love playing with paper planes, no matter what the age!

 Produced by award-winning toy manufacturer 4M, leaders in STEAM toys for kids.

 Educational but super fun nature of the toy makes it a winner with kids (and parents) - they don’t even realise they are learning science and engineering skills while they are building and playing with this toy.

 Age 8+

label_changes.title: For the love of Bees Gift Pack

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work. This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations! Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits. description:
Going up! Build an adorable robotic gecko that defies gravity to crawl up, down, and all around smooth vertical surfaces!

 As you assemble this motorised, multi-legged machine with suction cup feet and an innovative gear system, you’ll learn about its inner mechanisms including an electric circuit complete with motor, battery, and switch. Then experiment to see which types of surfaces your Geckobot can climb best and read about how suction cups work and how this robot climbs.

 This hands-on construction kit brings engineering and physics to life as it demonstrates the power of air pressure at work. A 16-page, full-colour manual guides your model building with step-by-step illustrated instructions.

  
 * Updated technology includes refined tooling for ease of assembly and more functional design for optimal performance 
 * Hands-on assembly develops fine motor skills and provides first-hand insight into the inner workings of robot  Age 8+
